intro: Barringtonia terrestris, commonly known as the ground ivy or creeping bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is a low-growing perennial that produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and thrives in moist, well-drained soils, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, aiding in its propagation. The plant is sometimes used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and flowers.
